title: (x) Swash font used by Phoenix Home & Garden magazine - Incognito {Stephen}
content:
Hi,

Does anybody know the name of the swash font used by Phoenix Home & Garden magazine? It kind of looks like Adobe’s Poetica. I have tried Whatthefont and looked through a few catalogues but cant find it. Probably will kick myself once someone tells me as I am sure I have seen it used somewhere else.

Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Swash1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219120728/http:/typophile.com/files/Swash1.jpg) | 46.24 KB |
| [Swash2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219120728/http:/typophile.com/files/Swash2.jpg) | 51.47 KB |
| [Swash3.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219120728/http:/typophile.com/files/Swash3.jpg) | 45.67 KB |

 [‹ Sears Holiday "Wish" typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219120728/http:/typophile.com/node/39680 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Free Software Directory rounded condensed sans serif - Kaffeesatz {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219120728/http:/typophile.com/node/40101 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mukhtarsanders

comments.content: Thank you very much Stephen - yep knew it when I saw it! It doesn’t come under Swash which is why it didn’t show up on FontFont’s website.
Yes, with more than 40,000 families we still have some keywording still do to. This is FontShop’s site, btw, FontFont is our foundry/label.
